sub_title: Research Intern at Westlake Epoxy |  Chemical Engineering Graduate at TU Delft | Under Graduate from Shiv Nadar University
summary:
I am Jai Singh, a master's student at the Chemical Engineer Dept of TU Delft. My decision to pursue Chemical Engineering stemmed from my desire to create path-breaking solutions that will directly impact society. I aspire to leverage my domain knowledge to solve real-world problems. I am quite passionate about climate change and the environment. As a person, I am result-oriented and very open to learning. I have the ability to initiate, plan, and execute the set plans.  I am actively crater to society by initiating social events.
I am an engineer by profession, a researcher at heart, and an environmentalist by the mind.
My other fields of interest are Process Development and Engineering, Process Innovation, Safety and Operability of chemical plants,  computational chemistry, molecular dynamic simulations, and Big Data Analysis.
My ultimate goal is to use my knowledge and engineering skills to reduce pollution and protect our environment and Mother Earth, by making processes cleaner and sustainable to achieve a circular economy.

projects.title: Intensification of MCC synthesis unit in UCC Bhopal Plant for Inherent Safety
projects.description:
The scope of this project is to redesign the MCC synthesis part of the process using the principles
of Process Intensification. It highlights the primary bottlenecks in the process, followed by a list
of design alternatives that have been decided that could potentially replace the components in
the MCC synthesis unit, in order to make the step inherently safe and more efficient. The most
suitable alternative was evaluated by comparing the alternatives with each other in a competitive
matrix where different parameters have been given weightage factors, which helped us to rank the
alternatives. Finally, a redesigned inherently safer MCC synthesis unit was proposed at the end of the project

projects.title: Pulsating electric field as an alternative process for starch gelatinization | Heineken
projects.description:
This project focuses on addressing the pressing challenge of reducing energy consumption in the brewing process, in line with Heineken's ambitious net-zero target by 2030. Specifically, it targets the mashing step, a critical process where enzymes break down key components in barley grains to facilitate fermentation. Central to this is starch gelatinization, which requires substantial heat.
The study explores innovative approaches to lower this energy demand, with a spotlight on Pulsating Electric Field (PEF) treatment. PEF treatment disrupts starch crystalline structures, lowering gelatinization temperature, and consequently, energy requirements. By incorporating this technique, the report introduces a novel pre-treatment process. This involves creating a barley-water paste, treated with PEF, before entering the mashing stage. The result is enhanced gelatinization, leading to improved energy efficiency.
A python model assessed the process's impact, considering factors like water content, heating fraction, and gelatinization time.  Implementation of this process is projected to yield impressive energy savings of 24.3% and electrify 9.5% of the mashing process.

projects.title: Atomistic Simulations of CO2 Adsorption on Hierarchical Zeolite-Supported Novel Solvents.
projects.description:
Grand Canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) simulations were performed to simulate adsorption isotherms on pure adsorbents: ZSM-5 and Na-Y zeolites, mesoporous silica MCM-41; Ionic Liquid impregnated zeolites.
The [BMIM][BF4] anchored MCM-41 adsorbent shows the highest CO2 adsorption capacity at 298 K as additional acid-base Interactions with CO2 come into play from ionic liquid. Thus, it can be used in carbon capture technology. 
Assumed the additional responsibility of lab in-charge, keeping inventory and acquiring chemicals and equipment to ensure the lab's efficient operation.

projects.title: Screening of Organic Solvents for Extractive Desulfurization of Fuel Oils
projects.description:
Density functional theory were implied to analyze the physical and chemical properties of the solvents. Interaction energies of solvents and solute were calculated to make a rational selection of the solvent based on its capacity and selectivity. 
• Molecular Dynamics simulations were performed using Biovia Material Studio to capture the distribution coefficients 
• This helped me gain insights into the use of computational chemistry and molecular simulation to do efficient research, which prompted me “excellent grade”.

profile_positions.description:
I volunteered as a CV advisor for TU Delft students, working under Career Centre. My role was to assist students in developing their resumes and motivation letters to increase their chances of landing their dream job.
Listening to the challenges students faced and helping them overcome those challenges also helped me improve my communication and interpersonal skills.
profile_positions.title: CV Adviser

profile_positions.description:
During my tenure, I had an opportunity to explore and actively participate in all aspects of operating a batch reactor dedicated to the manufacturing of Captan, a fungicide. This hands-on experience allowed me to gain a deep understanding of the intricate chemical processes and protocols involved in the production of this chemical compound.
The project was to investigate the types of stirrers to optimize the product yield by doing literature surveys.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineering Intern

profile_positions.description:
Worked on the topic "Intelligent Predictive Maintenance Model for Gas Compressors."
Acquired insights into different maintenance schemes and developed a predictive maintenance model using ML algorithms.
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
I extensively researched the topic of "Chemical Warfare: Survey". This study delved into the various types of chemical warfare, including their uses and how they can be classified. In addition, the research also explored the different methods of protection against chemical warfare, with a focus on the most effective techniques and equipment.
Furthermore, the study also analyzed the associated safety management issues that arise when dealing with chemical warfare. This included examining the potential risks and hazards that come with handling chemical weapons, as well as the best practices for minimizing these risks.
All in all, this research provided a thorough and detailed overview of chemical warfare, covering all important aspects of the topic and ensuring a complete understanding of this important subject matter.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Did Hand-on training in Chemical Testing of Metals by using Optical Emission spectrophotometer and Wet methods.
For water quality assessment: Detection of Metals in Drinking water was done using AAS / ICP, and for Pesticide Residue's quantitative analysis, GCMS was used.
Learned about various certified IS standards for quantitative analysis of commercial products like Packed water, TMT bars, and cement.

company.name: National Institutes For Pharmacy Education And Research

profile_positions.company: National Institutes For Pharmacy Education And Research
profile_positions.description:
Conducted research on the topic Preparation and Evaluation of Solid Dispersion of Diclofenac Sodium.
The research work aimed to improve the aqueous solubility of the drug "Diclofenac Sodium" by preparing the Solid Dispersion with the polymers, PVP K-30 and HPMC using a physical mixing method. Thus, the pharmaceutical formulation improved the drug's oral bioavailability. Based on available patents, in-depth research was accomplished in this project.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a team of five students, we had the opportunity to organize three exciting events throughout the academic year. Our first event was the Valentine's Borrel, where we organized a fun gathering and were able to collect 127 euros for the Turkey Disaster Fund. This event was a great way to kick off our event planning journey, and it helped increase our visibility and name across the TU Delft campus.

For our next event, we decided to collaborate with X-TU Delft to organize a Pizza Baking Competition. We were thrilled to see the event being a sold-out success. This collaboration allowed us to expand our network and reach out to more individuals. Through this event, we were able to bring together the TU Delft community and create an environment that was both competitive and fun.

Our final event was perhaps the most entertaining of all. We set up a gaming table in front of the TU Delft Library during the exam week. It was great to see students having fun with their friends while taking a break from studying. The event was a huge success, and we were able to create a positive impact on the students' well-being during the exam week. This experience motivated me to care more for my society, and I was able to make new friends and learn more about the inner workings of Delft while contributing to social causes that I care about deeply.

Overall, organizing these events was an incredibly enriching experience for us as a team. We learned how to collaborate effectively, developed our event planning skills and had a fun time while contributing to social causes that we are passionate about. We hope to continue organizing events that make a positive impact on the TU Delft community and beyond.

company.name: GoGreen Club, Shiv Nadar Institution of Eminence

volunteer_experiences.description:
I had the privilege of discovering a club dedicated to promoting environmental awareness, and I owe this opportunity to our mentor, Nishant Mishra from SNU. Together as a team, we successfully coordinated various events such as discussions, games, and even a collaborative project named "Message Missile" with Breeze SNU, our annual cultural fest. This initiative allowed us to connect with a broader audience and propagate the message of environmental preservation.
In addition, we partnered with the SPAS NGO to expand our outreach and create a positive impact in rural areas. Furthermore, we lent our support to the Shiv Nadar Foundation's annual afforestation project, actively participating in tree planting and environmental restoration efforts, leaving a lasting imprint on the world around us.

During my tenure, I had the opportunity to contribute and plan various initiatives that focused on raising environmental awareness. One such initiative was the "Water Preservation & Conservation" program, which aimed to educate individuals about the importance of water preservation and the steps they could take to conserve this vital resource.
In addition to my work on this initiative, I also had the chance to publish a magazine article that focused on the importance of environmental conservation and the role that individuals can play in protecting our planet. This article discussed various strategies that individuals can use to reduce their carbon footprint and help create a more sustainable future.

During my time with the Blue Circle Mental Team at SNU, I participated in various activities focused on promoting mental health and well-being. One notable event was the Yellow Ribbon Suicide Prevention Program. Through this initiative, we aimed to raise awareness about the significance of preventing suicide and offered resources and assistance to those facing mental health difficulties. I also had the opportunity to help arrange a guided meditation session designed to help people relax, unwind, and find inner peace and calmness. Overall, my experience with the Blue Circle Mental Team at SNU was highly fulfilling and allowed me to contribute to important efforts to enhance mental health on campus.
